title: The Number of Users That Are Eligible for Discount
description: You are tasked with determining the number of users who are eligible for a discount. A user is considered eligible if their total purchase amount is greater than or equal to a specified discount threshold. Given an array of purchase amounts and the discount threshold, return the count of users who are eligible for the discount.
input_format: An array of integers representing the purchase amounts and an integer representing the discount threshold.
output_format: An integer representing the number of users eligible for the discount.

examples.explanation: The eligible users have purchase amounts 250, 300, and 150, which are greater than or equal to the discount threshold of 200.
None of the users have a purchase amount greater than or equal to the discount threshold of 150.

hints: Iterate through the purchase_amounts array and count how many values meet or exceed the threshold.

title: The Users That Are Eligible for Discount
description: Given a list of users represented by their ages and purchase amounts, determine which users are eligible for a discount. A user is eligible for a discount if they are either under 18 years old or have made purchases totaling more than $1000.
input_format: A list of users, where each user is represented as a pair of integers [age, purchase_amount].
output_format: A list of integers representing the indices of users who are eligible for a discount.

examples.explanation: Users at indices 0 and 2 are eligible due to age, and user at index 1 is eligible due to purchase amount.
No users meet the eligibility criteria.

hints: Check each user's age and purchase_amount against the eligibility criteria.
